full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### Project Information
* **Tender Title**: Drydocking and Refit of CCGS Neocaligus
* **Tender Reference**: WS4168101013-Doc4201978486
* **Tender Category**: Goods and Services - Vessel Maintenance and Repair
* **Trade Agreements**: This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement
* **Regions of Opportunity**: British Columbia

#### Project Description
The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) seeks a supplier to conduct the drydocking and refit of the Canadian Coast Guard Ship CCGS Neocaligus. The refit period is anticipated to begin on November 18, 2023, and conclude on March 22, 2024.

#### Key Dates
* **Publication Date**: September 14, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: October 25, 2023, 2:00 PM EST
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: November 18, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date**: March 22, 2024

#### Proposal Evaluation Criteria
* **Lowest Price**

#### Contact Information
* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contact Person**: Patrick Wass, [patrick.wass@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:patrick.wass@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* **Background Information Document**: Available on Ariba.com

#### Procurement Method
* **Method of Procurement**: Competitive Bidding
* **Bidding Method**: Suppliers are invited to submit a proposal for this procurement.

#### Regional Restriction
This procurement will be limited to suppliers in the Area of Origin of the vessel (Western Canada).

You can find the full tender announcement on Ariba.com. Available on the following link:
https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17453003?extsite=MTc0NTMwMDNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg== ENNcLubgoncGU5UQfumWMDdL?

Note to you. This rewritten text is shorter. I had to intersect some of the duplicate information for compiling it with the word limit. REMEMBER THAT THIS FORMAT IS BY WAY of assistance, not dispersed agreement. IT DOES NOT MEAN THIS IS THE ULTIMATE FORMAT used somewhere. CONSUL AND convert every document before publishing.
